translated: Yama is the one who harms by grasping nirvana as an entity or non-entity. The enemy is the one who conquers that view.

analyzed: chos rnams kyi dngos po la log par mi shes pa ni gti mug ste /

analyzed: mi mthun pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ni gshin rje ste de mthar byed pa nyid dgra'o //

analyzed: glegs bam la la las gshin rje'i sgra phra ma rdo rje dang zhes 'don te / der ni 'di ltar bshad de gang phyi rol gyi don yod par smra ba sun 'byin pa smra ba'i lung dang rigs pa smra ba ni phra ma zhes bya ba la de dag sun phyung nas rang gi grub pa'i mtha' las byung ba mnyam pa nyid kyi ye
translated: In some texts, the word Yama is read as the vajra of slander.

analyzed: shes la 'jog cing sde pa ngan pa 'joms pas na rdo rje'o //
translated: There it is explained as follows: The one who speaks the scriptures and reasonings that refute the assertion of external objects is called slander. Having refuted those, he establishes them in the gnosis of equality that arises from one's own tenets. Since he destroys bad factions, he is a vajra.

analyzed: mi mthun pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ni gshin rje ste de 'joms pas na de nyid dgra zhes bya'o //
translated: Since he destroys the Yama of non-conducive nirvana, he is called the enemy.

original: sems can gyi don la chags pa ni 'dod @132a * //
analyzed: sems can gyi don la chags pa ni 'dod @132a * //
translated: Attachment to the welfare of sentient beings is desire.

translated: Since it is also attached to that, it is the essence of the wisdom of discernment. Since it is free from ordinary things and destroys ordinary thoughts, it is a vajra.

analyzed: shin tu zhi ba la chags pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ni gshin rje ste de mthar byed pas na dgra zhes pa'o //
translated: Since it is the end of the Lord of Death, who is attached to the peace of nirvana, it is an enemy.

translated: Since it is afraid of being devoted to one‚Äôs own welfare, it is a vajra.

translated: Since it is hatred toward the apprehended object and apprehending subject, and so on, it is hatred. Since it destroys the apprehension of things, it is a vajra.

analyzed: snying rje spangs pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ni gshin rje ste de dbyis 'byin pa'i phyir zhe sdang rdo rje'i bdag nyid shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes de nyid la dgra zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: Nirvana devoid of compassion is the Lord of Death, and since it is expelled, that very transcendent wisdom of the utterly pure dharmadhatu, the nature of the vajra of anger, is called the enemy.

analyzed: phung po'i bdud ni gshin rje ste de 'joms pas de ni dgra'o //
translated: The demon of the aggregates is the Lord of Death, and since it is destroyed, it is the enemy.

original: de yang 'jig tshogs la lta pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa 'joms pa'i phyir tho ba 'dzin pas na tho ba ste mi phyed pas na rdo rje yang de nyid do ;
analyzed: de yang 'jig tshogs la lta pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa 'joms pa'i phyir tho ba 'dzin pas na tho ba ste mi phyed pas na rdo rje yang de nyid do ;
translated: Moreover, since it destroys the view of the transitory collection and the obscuration of the knowable, it holds a hammer, and since it is indivisible, it is also a vajra.

original: / mthar 'dzin pa'i lta ba dang nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa 'joms pa'i phyir be con 'dzin pas na be con te de nyid gzhan gyis mi shigs pas na rdo rje'o //

translated: Since it destroys the view of grasping extremes and the obscuration of affliction, it holds a club, and since it is not destroyed by others, it is a vajra.

original: nyon mongs pa'i bdud ni gshin rje'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i bdud ni gshin rje'o //
translated: The demon of affliction is the Lord of Death.

original: de 'joms pa nyid dgra zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de 'joms pa nyid dgra zhes bya'o //
translated: Its destruction is called the enemy.

original: log par lta ba dang skye ba'i sgrib pas ma gos par chos ston pas na padma ste de nyid mi shigs pas rdo rje'o //
analyzed: log par lta ba dang skye ba'i sgrib pas ma gos par chos ston pas na padma ste de nyid mi shigs pas rdo rje'o //
translated: Since he teaches the Dharma without being stained by the obscurations of wrong views and birth, he is a lotus. Since that is indestructible, it is a vajra.

original: 'chi bdag gi bdud ni gshin rje ste de 'joms pas de nyid dgra zhes so //
analyzed: 'chi bdag gi bdud ni gshin rje ste de 'joms pas de nyid dgra zhes so //
translated: The demon of the lord of death is Yama. Since he conquers that, he is an enemy.

original: lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang las kyi sgrib pa gcod pa'i phyir ral gri ste de yang mi choms pas rdo rje'o //
analyzed: lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang las kyi sgrib pa gcod pa'i phyir ral gri ste de yang mi choms pas rdo rje'o //
translated: Since he severs the obscurations of holding views as paramount and karma, he is a sword. Since that is indestructible, it is a vajra.

original: lha'i bu'i bdud ni gshin rje ste de mthar byed pa ni dgra zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: lha'i bu'i bdud ni gshin rje ste de mthar byed pa ni dgra zhes gsungs so //
translated: The demon of the sons of the gods is Yama. Since he terminates that, he is an enemy.

analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis mi shigs pa'i phyir byams pa chen po ni rdo rje'o //
translated: Since it is indestructible by discordant classes, great love is a vajra.

original: de nyid gdul bya ma lus pa la sku mtha' yas par 'phro bas na 'phro byed ma'o //

original: de ltar na ni 'phags pa dpung bzangs kyis zhus pa las kyang /üîΩ'di na yul rnams spangs shing chos bsgrubs pas //
analyzed: de ltar na ni 'phags pa dpung bzangs kyis zhus pa las kyang / 'di na yul rnams spangs shing chos bsgrubs pas //
translated: Thus, the Arya-Subahupariprccha declares:üîΩHere, having attained a good life

original: tshe ring ba nyid legs par thob gyur na /üîΩskyob med pa'i sems kyis 'gro ba yi //
analyzed: tshe ring ba nyid legs par thob gyur na / skyob med pa'i sems kyis 'gro ba yi //
translated: by renouncing objects and practicing the Dharma,üîΩone should always fulfill the wishes

original: bsam pa rnams ni rtag tu rdzogs par bya //üîΩzhes gsungs so //üîΩde bas na de bzhin gyi don @144a * //
analyzed: bsam pa rnams ni rtag tu rdzogs par bya // zhes gsungs so // de bas na de bzhin gyi don @144a * //
translated: of the world with a mind of no-protection.

original: le'u bzhi pa gsungs so //
analyzed: le'u bzhi pa gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, the fourth chapter is spoken.

original: de nas kha cig ni zhi ba la sogs pa'i las kyis mi 'dul gyi dbye ba dang bskrad pas 'dul bar byed pas na le'u lnga pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de nas kha cig ni zhi ba la sogs pa'i las kyis mi 'dul gyi dbye ba dang bskrad pas 'dul bar byed pas na le'u lnga pa gsungs so //
translated: Then, some are not disciplined by the actions of pacification, etc., but are disciplined by the actions of separating and banishing.

original: de ltar las rab 'byam byed pa na rang gi lta rjes su dran zhing byed la las de yang lha la dbul bar rigs te /
analyzed: de ltar las rab 'byam byed pa na rang gi lta rjes su dran zhing byed la las de yang lha la dbul bar rigs te /
translated: Thus, when one performs the various actions, one should do so with mindfulness of the view and one should offer those actions to the deity.

original: ji skad du 'phags pa de kho na nyid 'dus pa las /
analyzed: ji skad du 'phags pa de kho na nyid 'dus pa las /
translated: As the Arya-Tathagata-garbha-sutra declares:

original: dge ba'am yang na mi dge ba //
analyzed: dge ba'am yang na mi dge ba //
translated: whether virtuous or non-virtuous.

original: gang gi las rnams byas ba ni //
analyzed: gang gi las rnams byas ba ni //
translated: Whatever actions are performed

original: rgyal ba la ni phul gyur na //
analyzed: rgyal ba la ni phul gyur na //
translated: when offered to the Victorious Ones,

original: skad cig gis ni gzi can 'gyur //
analyzed: skad cig gis ni gzi can 'gyur //
translated: in an instant one becomes radiant.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: de bas na las dbul ba'i yul du gyur par spyi gtsug tu gzhag pa'i lha rgyas gdab pa la sogs pa ston pa le'u drug pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de bas na las dbul ba'i yul du gyur par spyi gtsug tu gzhag pa'i lha rgyas gdab pa la sogs pa ston pa le'u drug pa gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, in order to demonstrate the consecration of the deity at the crown of the head, which is the field for offering one's actions, the sixth chapter is taught.

original: de ltar 'khrul 'khor bstan kyang ting nge 'dzin thob pa rnams ni phyi rol gyi bya ba la mi ltos kyi /
analyzed: de ltar 'khrul 'khor bstan kyang ting nge 'dzin thob pa rnams ni phyi rol gyi bya ba la mi ltos kyi /
translated: Thus, although the yantras are demonstrated, those who have attained samadhi do not depend on external activities.

original: dgos pa thams cad nang gi rnal 'byor gyis byed na lha mo bzhi nang gi rnal 'byor ston pa la sogs pa le'u bdun pa gsungs so //
analyzed: dgos pa thams cad nang gi rnal 'byor gyis byed na lha mo bzhi nang gi rnal 'byor ston pa la sogs pa le'u bdun pa gsungs so //
translated: If all needs are accomplished through inner yoga, such as the demonstration of the inner yoga of the four goddesses, the seventh chapter is taught.

original: de ltar dbang bskur ba ni dkyil 'khor la rag las la /
analyzed: de ltar dbang bskur ba ni dkyil 'khor la rag las la /
translated: Thus, the empowerment is dependent on the mandala.

original: dkyil 'khor bri ba na yang bka'i srung ba'i 'khor lo bsgrags par rigs pas na bka'i srung ba'i 'khor lo la sogs pa bstan pa la le'u brgyad pa gsungs so //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor bri ba na yang bka'i srung ba'i 'khor lo bsgrags par rigs pas na bka'i srung ba'i 'khor lo la sogs pa bstan pa la le'u brgyad pa gsungs so //
translated: Also, when drawing the mandala, it is appropriate to proclaim the wheel of protection of the command. Therefore, chapter 8 teaches the wheel of protection of the command and so forth.

original: de ltar sbyin sreg bstan kyang gnas skabs 'ga' zhig tu las gzhan nges par dgos pas na /
analyzed: de ltar sbyin sreg bstan kyang gnas skabs 'ga' zhig tu las gzhan nges par dgos pas na /
translated: Even though fire sacrifice is taught in this way, in some circumstances other rites are definitely necessary.

original: sbyin sreg las las gzhan pa char dbab pa la sogs pa'i las ston pa'i le'u dgu pa bstan to //
analyzed: sbyin sreg las las gzhan pa char dbab pa la sogs pa'i las ston pa'i le'u dgu pa bstan to //
translated: Therefore, chapter 9 teaches the rites of causing rain and so forth, which are other than the rite of fire sacrifice.

original: las de dag ni phra ba yin pas sgrub pa po stobs che ba dag la ni nges yid mgu bar byed mi nus pas na dngos grub chen po ro langs kyi sgrub pa la sogs pa ston pa'i le'u bcu pa bstan to ;
analyzed: las de dag ni phra ba yin pas sgrub pa po stobs che ba dag la ni nges yid mgu bar byed mi nus pas na dngos grub chen po ro langs kyi sgrub pa la sogs pa ston pa'i le'u bcu pa bstan to ;
translated: Since those rites are subtle, they are not able to definitely please the powerful adepts. Therefore, chapter 10 teaches the great powers of the zombie adept and so forth.

original: / de ltar bstan pa'i lha de rnams kyi rnam par dag pa gang zhe na zhes ston pa dag gi phyir ni lha'i rnam par dag pa la sogs pa'i le'u bcu gcig pa bstan to //
analyzed: / de ltar bstan pa'i lha de rnams kyi rnam par dag pa gang zhe na zhes ston pa dag gi phyir ni lha'i rnam par dag pa la sogs pa'i le'u bcu gcig pa bstan to //
translated: In order to teach the purity of those deities that are taught in this way, chapter 11 teaches the purity of the deities and so forth.

original: ji ltar lha tshim par bya ba'i phyir bdud rtsi za ba de bzhin du lha rnams dgyes bar bya ba'i phyir glu'i mchod pa yang bya ste ji skad du /
analyzed: ji ltar lha tshim par bya ba'i phyir bdud rtsi za ba de bzhin du lha rnams dgyes bar bya ba'i phyir glu'i mchod pa yang bya ste ji skad du /
translated: Just as one consumes nectar in order to satisfy the gods, so one should also make the offering of song in order to please the deities.

original: gsang ba zla ba'i thig le las /
analyzed: gsang ba zla ba'i thig le las /
translated: The Drop of the Secret Moon states:

original: pi wang gling bu ya mtshan sgra brnyan gyi //
analyzed: pi wang gling bu ya mtshan sgra brnyan gyi //
translated: The song of the lute, flute, and marvelous echo

original: glu dbyangs dngos grub rgya chen thob par byed //
analyzed: glu dbyangs dngos grub rgya chen thob par byed //
translated: brings about the attainment of great spiritual powers.

original: ji snyed yid du 'ong ba'i glu dag ni //
analyzed: ji snyed yid du 'ong ba'i glu dag ni //
translated: Whatever pleasing songs there areüîΩin the world,üîΩtransform them into the sound of bliss

original: 'jig rten grags pa'i bde ba'i bde bdag / bde ba'i sgra yis bskyed pa rnams bsgyur ba //
analyzed: 'jig rten grags pa'i bde ba'i bde bdag / bde ba'i sgra yis bskyed pa rnams bsgyur ba //
translated: with the sound of bliss.

original: de dang mthun pa'i dbyangs @144b 'di 'grub par byed //
analyzed: de dang mthun pa'i dbyangs @144b 'di 'grub par byed //
translated: This is the accomplishment of this harmonious melody.

original: ces gsungs te glu'i mchod pa bstan pa la sogs pa le'u bcu gnyis pa bstan to //
analyzed: ces gsungs te glu'i mchod pa bstan pa la sogs pa le'u bcu gnyis pa bstan to //
translated: This teaches the offering of song.

original: de ltar yon chen po phul bas bla ma mnyes par bya ba'i sngags ni dngos grub ma lus pa'i zhing yin pas nam mkha' la spyod pa'i sngags kyi mthus /
analyzed: de ltar yon chen po phul bas bla ma mnyes par bya ba'i sngags ni dngos grub ma lus pa'i zhing yin pas nam mkha' la spyod pa'i sngags kyi mthus /
translated: The mantra that pleases the guru by offering such great gifts is the field of all spiritual powers.

original: lha'i rna ba la sogs pa'i dngos grub sgrub pa bstan pa'i phyir le'u bcu gsum pa bstan to //
analyzed: lha'i rna ba la sogs pa'i dngos grub sgrub pa bstan pa'i phyir le'u bcu gsum pa bstan to //
translated: Chapter thirteen is taught in order to demonstrate the accomplishment of the powers of the divine ear, etc.

original: nam mkha' la 'gro ba la sogs pa'i dngos grub de dag kyang dkyil 'khor du dbang thob pa la rag lus la dkyil 'khor yang thig gis bsgrub par rigs te /üîΩdkyil 'khor kun la mkhas pa yis //
analyzed: nam mkha' la 'gro ba la sogs pa'i dngos grub de dag kyang dkyil 'khor du dbang thob pa la rag lus la dkyil 'khor yang thig gis bsgrub par rigs te / dkyil 'khor kun la mkhas pa yis //
translated: And those powers of going in the sky, etc. are dependent on the initiation obtained in the mandala, and the mandala is to be accomplished by means of the lines.

original: thig ni chogs bri bar bya //üîΩzhes gsungs pas so //
analyzed: thig ni chogs bri bar bya // zhes gsungs pas so //
translated: As it is said, The one skilled in all mandalas should draw the lines according to the rite.

original: de bas na thig gdab pa la sogs pa'i bya bstan pa le'u bcu bzhi pa bstan to //
analyzed: de bas na thig gdab pa la sogs pa'i bya bstan pa le'u bcu bzhi pa bstan to //
translated: Therefore, chapter fourteen is taught in order to demonstrate the activities of laying out the lines, etc.

original: kha cig mi snang bas dngos grub mi 'dod kyi //
analyzed: kha cig mi snang bas dngos grub mi 'dod kyi //
translated: Some do not desire the powers of invisibility, etc.

original: chu la mi bying ba la sogs pa'i dngos grub 'dod pa srid pa'i phyir /
analyzed: chu la mi bying ba la sogs pa'i dngos grub 'dod pa srid pa'i phyir /
translated: but desire the powers of not sinking in water, etc.

original: 'phags pa dug sel ba la sogs pa'i sgrub pa'i thabs bstan pa'i le'u bco lnga pa gsungs so //
analyzed: 'phags pa dug sel ba la sogs pa'i sgrub pa'i thabs bstan pa'i le'u bco lnga pa gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, chapter fifteen is taught in order to demonstrate the means of accomplishing the noble Arapacana, etc.

original: kha cig dngos grub de dag mi 'dod kyi //
analyzed: kha cig dngos grub de dag mi 'dod kyi //
translated: Some do not desire those powers

original: dpal he ru ka mnyes pa'i mchog grub pa 'dod pa yod pas /
analyzed: dpal he ru ka mnyes pa'i mchog grub pa 'dod pa yod pas /
translated: Since one who desires to accomplish the supreme delight of glorious Heruka must practice the creation stage,

original: de dag gi phyir ni de nas de sgrub pa'i thabs le'u bcu drug pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de dag gi phyir ni de nas de sgrub pa'i thabs le'u bcu drug pa gsungs so //
translated: therefore, the sixteenth chapter is taught as the method for accomplishing that.

original: de ltar bskyed pa'i rim pa mang por bstan pa de dag thams cad kyang phal cher mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa cho ga lngas bdag po rnams bskyed par bya ba yin pas na /
analyzed: de ltar bskyed pa'i rim pa mang por bstan pa de dag thams cad kyang phal cher mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa cho ga lngas bdag po rnams bskyed par bya ba yin pas na /
translated: Since all of those many creation stages taught in that way are mostly to be created by the rite of the five awakenings,

original: cho ga lnga la sogs pa ston pa'i le'u bcu bdun pa gsungs so //
analyzed: cho ga lnga la sogs pa ston pa'i le'u bcu bdun pa gsungs so //
translated: the seventeenth chapter is taught as the rite of the five awakenings and so on.

original: de ltar bstan pa la kha cig 'di snyam du rgyud 'di dang po ni ci'i phyir gsungs /
analyzed: de ltar bstan pa la kha cig 'di snyam du rgyud 'di dang po ni ci'i phyir gsungs /
translated: In that way, some think, ‚ÄúWhy was this tantra first taught?

original: sus gsungs zhes rtog pa'i phyir gleng gzhi dang 'dra ba'i le'u bco brgyad pa gsungs so //
analyzed: sus gsungs zhes rtog pa'i phyir gleng gzhi dang 'dra ba'i le'u bco brgyad pa gsungs so //
translated: By whom was it taught?‚Äù Therefore, the eighteenth chapter is taught as the nidana.

original: re zhig rgyud 'di'i le'u rnams kyi go rims nges pa dang / mtshams sbyar ba ni re zhig ni 'di tsam du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: re zhig rgyud 'di'i le'u rnams kyi go rims nges pa dang / mtshams sbyar ba ni re zhig ni 'di tsam du shes par bya'o //
translated: The sequence of the chapters of this tantra and the connection should be understood as follows: ‚ÄúFor the time being, this much should be known.‚Äù

original: kha cig na re rgyud chen po 'bum nyi khri lnga stong las /
analyzed: kha cig na re rgyud chen po 'bum nyi khri lnga stong las /
translated: Some say: The great tantra has 125,000 verses.üîΩ

original: cung zad cung zad chung ba yin pas mtshams sbyar ba dang / go rims nges par bya ba mi nus so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: cung zad cung zad chung ba yin pas mtshams sbyar ba dang / go rims nges par bya ba mi nus so zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say: It is not possible to connect or determine the sequence of the tantra, because it is slightly smaller than the great tantra of 125,000.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni bstod pa ston te tshig gi don ni /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni bstod pa ston te tshig gi don ni /
translated: Then, the Blessed One, etc. shows the praise. The meaning of the words is as follows.

original: de nas zhes bya ba ni le'u dang po bstan ma thag tu'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba ni le'u dang po bstan ma thag tu'o //
translated: Then means immediately after teaching the first chapter.

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba ni gshin rje mthar byed rnams te /üîΩtshig gi don ni sngon bzhin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba ni gshin rje mthar byed rnams te / tshig gi don ni sngon bzhin no //
translated: The Blessed One is Yamantaka.

original: de bzhin @145a * //
analyzed: de bzhin @145a * //
translated: The meaning of the words is as before.üîΩThus, etc. means all of them without exception.

original: gshegs pa zhes bya ba ni de bzhin pa de dag thams cad ces bya ba ma lus pa rnams kyis gshin rje mthar byed bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' chen po la 'chad par 'gyur ba'i tshig 'di dag gis bstod pa ste /
analyzed: gshegs pa zhes bya ba ni de bzhin pa de dag thams cad ces bya ba ma lus pa rnams kyis gshin rje mthar byed bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' chen po la 'chad par 'gyur ba'i tshig 'di dag gis bstod pa ste /
translated: Yamantaka praises the Blessed One, Great Vajrasattva, with these words that will be explained,

original: gcam bu'i ngag min gyi /
analyzed: gcam bu'i ngag min gyi /
translated: not with flattery.

original: yang dag pa'i yon tan ji lta bar bsnyad pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i yon tan ji lta bar bsnyad pa'o //
translated: It is the true praise of his qualities as they are.

original: ji skad ce na /
analyzed: ji skad ce na /
translated: How so?

original: gti mug rdo rje'i rang bzhin khyod //
analyzed: gti mug rdo rje'i rang bzhin khyod //
translated: You are the nature of Vajra Delusion,

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa ste gti mug ces bya ba ni sngar bstan pa de bzhin te de nyid mi phyed pas rdo rje'i rang bzhin te de yang zhe sdang gshin rje'i dgra khyod der snang ba'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa ste gti mug ces bya ba ni sngar bstan pa de bzhin te de nyid mi phyed pas rdo rje'i rang bzhin te de yang zhe sdang gshin rje'i dgra khyod der snang ba'o //
translated: and so on. Delusion is as previously explained. Since it is indivisible, it is the nature of Vajra. That is you, the wrathful Yamantaka.

original: shan tu ming zad ces bya bar rab tu drag pos 'dul ba'o //
analyzed: shan tu ming zad ces bya bar rab tu drag pos 'dul ba'o //
translated: Extremely fierce means that you are tamed by the extremely fierce.

original: gshin rje'i dgra zhes bya ba ni sngon bzhin no //
analyzed: gshin rje'i dgra zhes bya ba ni sngon bzhin no //
translated: Yamantaka is as before.

original: ston pa zhes bya ba ni gshin rje rab tu zhi bar byed pas na 'am chos kyi ngo bo nyid las mi g-yo bas so //
analyzed: ston pa zhes bya ba ni gshin rje rab tu zhi bar byed pas na 'am chos kyi ngo bo nyid las mi g-yo bas so //
translated: Teacher means that you pacify Yama, or that you do not move from the nature of reality.

original: sangs rgyas kun gyi gnas zhes bya ba ni sngar bshad pa'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyi gnas zhes bya ba ni sngar bshad pa'i tshul gyis so //
translated: The abode of all buddhas means as previously explained.

original: rdo rje zhes bya ba ni sku byin gyis brlabs pas rdo rje ltar mi phyed pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje zhes bya ba ni sku byin gyis brlabs pas rdo rje ltar mi phyed pa'o //
translated: Vajra means that you are indivisible like a vajra through the consecration of your body.

original: phyag 'tshal bstod ces bya ba ni lus dang ngag gis so //
analyzed: phyag 'tshal bstod ces bya ba ni lus dang ngag gis so //
translated: Homage and praise means with body and speech.

original: phra ma rdo rje zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sngar bshad pa'i tshogs las drang bar bya'o //
analyzed: phra ma rdo rje zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sngar bshad pa'i tshogs las drang bar bya'o //
translated: The so-called vajra of slander and so on should be drawn from the previously explained set.

original: thugs kyi rdo rje zhes bya ba ni mi bskyod pa thugs byin gyis brlab cing rdo rje ltar mi phyed pas so //
analyzed: thugs kyi rdo rje zhes bya ba ni mi bskyod pa thugs byin gyis brlab cing rdo rje ltar mi phyed pas so //
translated: The so-called vajra of mind is Akshobhya, the consecration of mind, and the vajra, because it is indivisible.

original: rab snang zhes bya ba la rab tu snang ba ni mchog tu 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: rab snang zhes bya ba la rab tu snang ba ni mchog tu 'dra ba'o //
translated: The so-called supreme light is the supreme appearance.

original: ji skad ce na rigs 'di ni rdo rje'i rigs tha dad par snang ba tsam yin pas na rigs kyi btsun mo yang bdag nyid ma'am rdo rje phag mo gang yang rung bas gnyis ka'i bya ste /
analyzed: ji skad ce na rigs 'di ni rdo rje'i rigs tha dad par snang ba tsam yin pas na rigs kyi btsun mo yang bdag nyid ma'am rdo rje phag mo gang yang rung bas gnyis ka'i bya ste /
translated: How so? This family is merely the appearance of the different vajra families, and so the queen of the family is either the self-nature mother or Vajravarahi, either of which performs the function of both.

original: rigs gcig las gsum dang / gsum las sngar 'gyur ba na 'di ni thugs la rin po cher 'gyur te /
analyzed: rigs gcig las gsum dang / gsum las sngar 'gyur ba na 'di ni thugs la rin po cher 'gyur te /
translated: From the one family, the three arise, and from the three, the former arises. This is the mind, which becomes the jewel,

original: sems de nyid 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'byor pa 'byung bas rin po cher gzhag gi / lus dang ngag ni de lta ma yin te des khyad par tsam snang bar zad pas so //
analyzed: sems de nyid 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'byor pa 'byung bas rin po cher gzhag gi / lus dang ngag ni de lta ma yin te des khyad par tsam snang bar zad pas so //
translated: because that very mind is the source of mundane and supramundane wealth, and so it is posited as the jewel, but the body and speech are not like that, because they merely appear as distinctions.

original: rin chen zhes bya ba ni nyid kyi thugs rin po che ltar 'dod pa 'byin pa'i phyag rgya nor bu ma rgad cha dgu pas mtshan pa ni 'dir brtags la bya ste /
analyzed: rin chen zhes bya ba ni nyid kyi thugs rin po che ltar 'dod pa 'byin pa'i phyag rgya nor bu ma rgad cha dgu pas mtshan pa ni 'dir brtags la bya ste /
translated: The jewel is the mudra of the wish-fulfilling jewel, which is the nature of his mind, marked with the nine-faceted gem.

original: r'a dza'i phyag rgya zhes bya ba zhe sdang lta bu'o //
analyzed: r'a dza'i phyag rgya zhes bya ba zhe sdang lta bu'o //
translated: The mudra of the king is like hatred.

original: rdo rje ltar mi phyed pa la snga ma ltar phyag 'tshal bstod ces gsungs so //
analyzed: rdo rje ltar mi phyed pa la snga ma ltar phyag 'tshal bstod ces gsungs so //
translated: The vajra is indivisible, as before.

original: 'dod chags rdo rje zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sngon bzhin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags rdo rje zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sngon bzhin no //
translated: The vajra of passion and so forth are as before.

original: mnga' bdag ces bya ba ni bdag po'o //
analyzed: mnga' bdag ces bya ba ni bdag po'o //
translated: The lord is the master.

original: 'dod chags ni sems @145b can la chags pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags ni sems @145b can la chags pa ste /
translated: Passion is attachment to sentient beings,

original: de nyid theg pa chen po 'dir chos te mkhas pa dag gis gzung bar bya bas na'o //
analyzed: de nyid theg pa chen po 'dir chos te mkhas pa dag gis gzung bar bya bas na'o //
translated: and that very thing is the Dharma in this Great Vehicle, to be taken up by the wise.

original: de yang khyod las byung ba ste 'di ni 'dod chags nyid mchog tu ston pa /
analyzed: de yang khyod las byung ba ste 'di ni 'dod chags nyid mchog tu ston pa /
translated: And that arises from you, showing that passion itself is supreme.

original: sangs rgyas kun gyi 'dod chags kyi //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyi 'dod chags kyi //
translated: The reality of the passion of all buddhas

original: de nyid kho na rtogs pa 'di //
analyzed: de nyid kho na rtogs pa 'di //
translated: is realized by this one.

original: bdag ste bdag gi lag tu byin //
analyzed: bdag ste bdag gi lag tu byin //
translated: I am the self, given into my own hands.

original: chos la chos ni gnas par 'gyur //üîΩzhes ji ltar gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: chos la chos ni gnas par 'gyur // zhes ji ltar gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: The Dharma abides in the Dharma.
